rComments: An outstanding professor. She manages to teach students without the assumptions of their knowledge while also not talking down to the students. The course materials chosen by her are excellent and her lectures perfectly supplement these. She expects effort on your part, not passive participation in the class. Very approachable in office hours too.

She has high expectations for her students. Clearly knowledgeable and intelligent, yet very approachable. She co-taught the course w/ Prof. Atanasoski (fem studies) who is also great. My only regret is not devoting more time to the material and the creative project. Definitely one of my favorite anthro professors.

Mayanthi is a great and knowledgeable professor, but she's not for everybody. Unlike most UCSC anthro faculty, she'll expect you to be actively engaged in class discussions, having read and processed the assigned materials. She gives a lot of criticism, which can seem somewhat off-putting, but it's ultimately constructive and meant to help you as a

She is a great professor. She is knowledgeable, intelligent, but very demanding. Although this year she stopped giving pop quizzes, she is a very hard grader for her essays. If you are interested in improving your writing and analytical skills, take her. She writes almost a page response (typed) for your essays and she really wants you to learn.

She is EXTREMELY knowledgeable on the topics that she teaches. The degree of time and effort given to individual students was very refreshing (she always had a lecture prepared, answered any and all questions clearly and fully, and graded/returned papers promptly). The most involved professor I have ever had. I recommend her classes.

I loved this class. There's a lot of reading, but I came in with NO background in anthro but it was clear and understandable. GO TO LECTURE! She's a great teacher and makes concepts understandable. Three essays including a final paper on a film or novel. Fair grading, cares a lot about grammar. Awesome class!

Prof. Fernando is a very challenging teacher.  I took Anth. approaches to Islam.  class was challenging, but excellent.  as far as professors go she is about as good as ive had. knows her****, down to earth, manageable/organized class, but demanding. she's gorgeous too

She loves her subject. Be sure to do the reading, even if you have trouble understanding it because if you don't then you'll be lost. This class was easy, and extra credit was even offered more than once. Occasional pop quiz! & Know the provided study guides completely and you'll do well even if you don't participate in class.
